edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course

Class Activity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Activity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Course

    public abstract class Activity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Conflict
    Interface that outlines the information and behaviors common to all Activities
    Author:
    kmbrown

      • setActivityTime

        public void setActivityTime(int startTime,
                            int endTime)
        This method sets the starting and ending time for the Activity meetings. Checks start time and end time integers to ensure that they are valid clock times and compares start and end time for validity as a meeting period. Also checks that Course meeting times are not being set for an arranged Course.
        Parameters:
        startTime - an int passed as the starting time for the Activity
        endTime - an int passed as the ending time for the Activity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if times aren't valid clock times, the end time is before the start time, or the Course is set as arranged

      • getMeetingString

        public java.lang.String getMeetingString()
        Generates a formatted String of the Activity's meeting days and times
        Returns:
        the Activity's meeting days and times as a formatted String

      • validTime

        public boolean validTime(int time)
        Checks whether the int passed as a meeting time for the Activity is a valid clock time
        Parameters:
        time - the time to check in 24 hour clock format
        Returns:
        true if time is a valid time

      • formatMeetingTimes

        private void formatMeetingTimes()
        Formats the meeting times of the Activity by identifying whether the start or end time is AM or PM and calling appropriate formatting method, then combining formatted times into formatted String which is saved as meetingTimes

      • convertToStandardAM

        private java.lang.String convertToStandardAM(int time)
        Converts 24hour clock time to 12hour clock time and formats String with AM

        Returns:

      • getLongDisplayArray

        Returns:

      • isDuplicate

        public abstract boolean isDuplicate(Activity activity)
        Checks whether an Activity is a duplicate of an Activity already on the Student's schedule
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to be compared to the Activities already present on the schedule
        Returns:
        true if the Activity is already present on the Schedule

      • checkConflict

        public void checkConflict(Activity possibleConflictingActivity)
                   throws ConflictException
        Checks whether two Activities are potentially in schedule conflict, which is defined as having any overlap in meeting time between the Activity calling the method and the Activity passed as the method parameter
        Specified by:
        checkConflict in interface Conflict
        Parameters:
        possibleConflictingActivity - one of the Activities which must be checked to ensure that meeting times are not in conflict
        Throws:
        ConflictException - if there is any overlap in meeting time
